content:
FALSE. The claim that the 2023 UEFA Champions League Final was held at the Camp Nou in Barcelona is incorrect[1][2][3]. The final was hosted at the Atatürk Olympic Stadium in Istanbul, Turkey[4][5][6].

## 2023 UEFA Champions League Final Overview

### Match Details
The 2022–23 UEFA Champions League season concluded on Saturday, June 10, 2023[7][4]. The final match was contested between English club Manchester City and Italian club Inter Milan[1][3]. Manchester City won the final 1–0, with Rodri scoring the winning goal and being named Man of the Match[7][3]. The match had a reported attendance of 71,412[7].

### Host Venue: Atatürk Olympic Stadium
The final was held at the Atatürk Olympic Stadium, located in the Başakşehir district of Istanbul, Turkey[8][9]. It is Turkey's largest stadium, with a capacity cited between 74,753 and 77,000 spectators[8][1][2].

This was the second time the Atatürk Olympic Stadium hosted the UEFA Champions League final; the first was the memorable 2005 final where Liverpool defeated AC Milan on penalties[3][6]. Istanbul was originally scheduled to host the 2021 final, but host cities were shifted back due to the COVID-19 pandemic, moving Istanbul's hosting duties to 2023[10][9].

### Camp Nou's Hosting History
While it was not the venue for the 2023 final, the Camp Nou in Barcelona has hosted the event on two previous occasions:
*   **1999:** Manchester United vs. Bayern Munich[11].
*   **1989:** AC Milan vs. Steaua Bucharest[11].
